directives.label: rem-prerequisite-drifts
directives.title: Summary of Required Operator Drifts
directives.content:
The following drift inequalities are established in the prerequisite documents and used throughout:

| Component | Cloning Drift (03_cloning.md) | Kinetic Drift (05_kinetic_contraction.md) |
|:-------...

directives.label: def-full-lyapunov-recall
directives.title: Synergistic Lyapunov Function (Recall)
directives.content:
From 03_cloning.md Definition 3.3.1:

$$
V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)
$$

where:
- $V_W = V_{\text{loc}} + V_{\text{struct}}$: Inter-sw...
directives.first_math: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)

directives.content:

directives.label: def-cemetery-state
directives.title: The Cemetery State
directives.content:
The **cemetery state** $\dagger$ is the absorbing state where all walkers are dead:

$$\dagger := \{(x_i, v_i, 0) : i = 1, \ldots, N\}$$

Once the swarm enters this state, it remains there forever (no...

directives.label: rem-extinction-inevitable
directives.title: Why Extinction is Inevitable (Eventually)
directives.content:
The use of **unbounded Gaussian noise** means:

$$P(\text{all } N \text{ walkers cross boundary in one step} \mid S) > 0$$

for ANY state $S$, no matter how safe. This is because Gaussian tails extend...
directives.first_math: P(\text{all } N \text{ walkers cross boundary in one step} \mid S) > 0

directives.label: def-qsd
directives.title: Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD)
directives.content:
A **quasi-stationary distribution** is a probability measure $\nu_{\text{QSD}}$ on the alive state space $\Sigma_N^{\text{alive}} := \{S : |\mathcal{A}(S)| \geq 1\}$ such that:

$$
P(S_{t+1} \in A \mi...

directives.label: thm-phi-irreducibility
directives.title: φ-Irreducibility of the Euclidean Gas
directives.content: The Euclidean Gas Markov chain on $\Sigma_N^{\text{alive}}$ is **φ-irreducible** with respect to Lebesgue measure: For any starting state $S_A \in \Sigma_N^{\text{alive}}$ and any open set $O_B \subse...
directives.first_math: P^M(S_A, O_B) := P(S_M \in O_B \mid S_0 = S_A) > 0

directives.label: thm-aperiodicity
directives.title: Aperiodicity of the Euclidean Gas
directives.content:
The Euclidean Gas Markov chain is **aperiodic**: For any state $S \in \Sigma_N^{\text{alive}}$ and any open set $U$ containing $S$, there exist integers $m, n$ with $\gcd(m,n) = 1$ such that:

$$

directives.title: Geometric Ergodicity and Convergence to QSD

directives.title: Equilibrium Variance Bounds from Drift Inequalities
directives.content:
The quasi-stationary distribution satisfies explicit variance bounds derived from the component drift inequalities:

directives.label: attr-velocity-rate-explicit
directives.title: Velocity Dissipation Rate (Parameter-Explicit)
directives.content:
The velocity variance dissipation rate and equilibrium constant are:

$$
\kappa_v = 2\gamma - O(\tau)
$$

$$
C_v' = \frac{d \sigma_v^2}{\gamma} + O(\tau \sigma_v^2)
$$

**Proof:**

From the BAOAB sche...

directives.label: attr-position-rate-explicit
directives.title: Positional Contraction Rate (Parameter-Explicit)
directives.content:
The positional variance contraction rate depends on the cloning rate $\lambda$ and the fitness-variance correlation:

$$

directives.label: attr-wasserstein-rate-explicit
directives.title: Wasserstein Contraction Rate (Parameter-Explicit)
directives.content:
The Wasserstein contraction rate depends on friction and the spectral gap of the potential:

$$
\kappa_W = \frac{c_{\text{hypo}}^2 \gamma}{1 + \gamma^2/\lambda_{\min}^2}
$$

- $c_{\text{hypo}} ...

directives.title: Boundary Contraction Rate (Parameter-Explicit)

directives.label: thm-synergistic-rate-derivation
directives.title: Synergistic Rate Derivation from Component Drifts
directives.content:
The total drift inequality combines component-wise drift bounds from cloning and kinetic operators to yield explicit synergistic convergence.

directives.label: thm-total-rate-explicit
directives.title: Total Convergence Rate (Parameter-Explicit)
directives.content:
The total geometric convergence rate is:

$$
\kappa_{\text{total}} = \min(\kappa_x, \kappa_v, \kappa_W, \kappa_b) \cdot (1 - \epsilon_{\text{coupling}})
$$

where $\epsilon_{\text{coupling}} \ll 1$ is...

directives.label: attr-mixing-time-explicit
directives.title: Mixing Time (Parameter-Explicit)
directives.content:
The time to reach $\epsilon$-proximity to equilibrium is:

$$
T_{\text{mix}}(\epsilon) = \frac{1}{\kappa_{\text{total}}} \ln\left(\frac{V_{\text{total}}^{\text{init}}}{\epsilon C_{\text{total}}}\right...

directives.label: attr-parameter-classification

directives.content:
Parameters can be grouped into five functional classes:

These parameters have **first-order effects** on convergence rates:

directives.label: def-rate-sensitivity-matrix
directives.title: Log-Sensitivity Matrix for Convergence Rates
directives.content:
The **rate sensitivity matrix** $M_\kappa \in \mathbb{R}^{4 \times 12}$ is defined by:

$$
(M_\kappa)_{ij} = \frac{\partial \log \kappa_i}{\partial \log P_j}\bigg|_{P_0}
$$

where $\kappa = (\kappa_x,...

directives.label: thm-explicit-rate-sensitivity
directives.title: Explicit Rate Sensitivity Matrix
directives.content:
At a balanced operating point with $\gamma \approx \lambda \approx \sqrt{\lambda_{\min}}$, $\lambda_{\text{alg}} = 0.1$, $\tau = 0.01$, the rate sensitivity matrix is approximately:

$$
M_\kappa = \be...

directives.label: def-equilibrium-sensitivity-matrix
directives.title: Equilibrium Constant Sensitivity Matrix
directives.content:
$$
(M_C)_{ij} = \frac{\partial \log C_i}{\partial \log P_j}\bigg|_{P_0}
$$

where $\mathbf{C} = (C_x, C_v, C_W, C_b)$.

directives.label: thm-svd-rate-matrix
directives.title: SVD of Rate Sensitivity Matrix
directives.content:
The singular value decomposition of $M_\kappa \in \mathbb{R}^{4 \times 12}$ is:

$$
M_\kappa = U \Sigma V^T
$$

where:
- $U \in \mathbb{R}^{4 \times 4}$ has orthonormal columns (left singular vectors,...

directives.label: attr-condition-number-rate
directives.title: Condition Number of Rate Sensitivity
directives.content:
$$
\kappa(M_\kappa) = \frac{\sigma_1}{\sigma_4} = \frac{1.58}{0.29} \approx 5.4
$$

This is a **moderately well-conditioned** matrix:
- Not too sensitive (would have $\kappa > 100$ for ill-conditioned...
